page.title: 10DAIRY FARMING (MILKING)
page.content: Many of the farms in this area are dairy farms which keep cows for milk.The cows get milked twice a day from six o 'clock to half past eight then from four o 'clock to six o' clock.It takes about ten minutes for each cow to be milked.The farmer usually has about one hundred and twenty milking cows but in summer some of the cows calf.The milking parlour will have room for five to ten cows at each side.The four clusters pump the milk from the udder through some pipes into the tank where it is stirred up to be kept cool. There are different breeds of cow but the best for milking are friesians and holsteins.Jerseys give less milk but it is creamier.The milk gets transfered by milk tanker to the dairy where it is cleaned and bottled.
